comment.text:

bugs.title: CVE-2024-42353 python-webob: WebOb's location header normalization during redirect leads to open redirect [fedora-all]

long_desc.thetext:
More information about this security flaw is available in the following bug:

https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2305004

Disclaimer: Community trackers are created by Red Hat Product Security team on a best effort basis. Package maintainers are required to ascertain if the flaw indeed affects their package, before starting the update process.

FEDORA-2024-8421f30719 (python-webob-1.8.8-1.fc39) has been submitted as an update to Fedora 39.
https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2024-8421f30719

FEDORA-2024-6df8e979fd (python-webob-1.8.8-1.fc40) has been submitted as an update to Fedora 40.

FEDORA-2024-8421f30719 has been pushed to the Fedora 39 testing repository.
Soon you'll be able to install the update with the following command:
`sudo dnf upgrade --enablerepo=updates-testing --refresh --advisory=FEDORA-2024-8421f30719`
You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2024-8421f30719

See also https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for more information on how to test updates.
